Package com.dms.controller

Class DocumentController

java.lang.Object
com.dms.controller.DocumentController
All Implemented Interfaces:
DocumentsApi
@RestController public class DocumentController extends Object implements DocumentsApi
Controller handling /documents endpoints.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Jakub Pavlíček

    • getDocumentRevisions

      public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<PageWithRevisionsDTO> getDocumentRevisions(String documentId, Integer page, Integer limit, String sort, String filter)
      Description copied from interface: DocumentsApi
      GET /documents/{documentId}/revisions : List document revisions Retrieves a list of document revisions.
      Specified by:
      getDocumentRevisions in interface DocumentsApi
      Parameters:
      documentId - The document ID. (required)
      page - The page number for pagination. (optional, default to 0)
      limit - The maximum number of items to return per page. (optional, default to 10)
      sort - A comma-separated list of sort keys. Valid keys are 'revision_id', 'name', 'type', 'size', 'version', 'created_at'. Each key can be sorted by either: asc (ascending order) or desc (descending order). Example usage: ?sort=name:desc,type:asc. (optional, default to name:asc)
      filter - A comma-separated list of filter keys. Valid keys are 'name', 'type'. Each key can be filtered using any value wrapped in quotation marks. Filtering works by checking whether the string contains the given substring. Example usage: ?filter=name:\"logo\",type:\"image\" (optional, default to name:\"\")
      Returns:
      Successfully retrieved list of the revisions. (status code 200) or Some of the parameters are missing or not valid. (status code 400) or Either no access token was provided or the provided access token is invalid or expired. (status code 401) or Document not found. (status code 404)

    • getDocuments

      public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<PageWithDocumentsDTO> getDocuments(Integer page, Integer limit, String sort, String filter)
      Description copied from interface: DocumentsApi
      GET /documents : List documents Retrieves a list of the documents.
      Specified by:
      getDocuments in interface DocumentsApi
      Parameters:
      page - The page number for pagination. (optional, default to 0)
      limit - The maximum number of items to return per page. (optional, default to 10)
      sort - A comma-separated list of sort keys. Valid keys are 'document_id', 'name', 'type', 'path', 'size', 'version', 'created_at', 'updated_at'. Each key can be sorted by either: asc (ascending order) or desc (descending order). Example usage: ?sort=name:desc,type:asc. (optional, default to name:asc)
      filter - A comma-separated list of filter keys. Valid keys are 'name', 'type', 'path', 'is_archived'. Each key can be filtered using any value wrapped in quotation marks. Filtering works by checking whether the string contains the given substring. Note that when using 'is_archived', true will be applied only for given values: \"True\" or \"true\", otherwise false will be applied. Example usage: ?filter=name:\"logo\",type:\"image\",is_archived:\"false\" (optional, default to name:\"\")
      Returns:
      Successfully retrieved list of the documents. (status code 200) or Some of the parameters are missing or not valid. (status code 400) or Either no access token was provided or the provided access token is invalid or expired. (status code 401)

      public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<DocumentDTO> moveDocument(String documentId, DestinationDTO destination)

      Specified by:

(status code 404) or File with path already exists. (status code 409) or Request does not contain any data. (status code 415)

      Specified by:
